metadata.titel_preek: First Sermon: The Justification of the Ungodly

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the 'legal train' of human guilt and cosmic death to justify and remake the ungodly through the sacrifice of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God shows his love for us
God is the one who justifies
the Son of God... has stepped out in front to protect us
to be remade in the image of the new Adam
make right what has been wrong
the righteousness of God was absolutely central
The ungodly people are you and me
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strictly as the Receiver/Beneficiary.

helper.identificatie: The Blood of Jesus / The Sacrifice
tekstueel_bewijs: justified by the blood of Jesus
remade by the sacrifice of Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Himself).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that 'remakes' the image.

tekstueel_bewijs: in the grip of Sin and Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an inescapable 'grip' and a 'legal train' leading to condemnation.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to represent the defenseless (Alaric Piette) as a reflection of divine justice.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Lt. Alaric Piette
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action is presented as a 'dim reflection' of the primary divine action.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Blood of Christ → God/Christ ← Sin and Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is the one who justifies the ungodly.
God is able to do mighty works.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Abraham knew better than to trust in his own good works.

voorbeelden: how I look forward to that day!
If you understand this, you are already being remade.
God is able to do mighty works

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'Non-Pouvoir' (helplessness) met by Divine 'Pouvoir' (justification). It bypasses 'Devoir' (moral obligation) as the engine of salvation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S2 (the inadequacy of simple forgiveness/impunity) to S2 (the reality of guilt/condemnation) and finally to S1 (Justification) via the death of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between mercy and justice is resolved not by ignoring guilt, but by God 'stepping in front' of the legal train.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon insists on the 'indefensible' nature of the sinner.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly attacks the 'Great American Gospel' of self-help and positions God as the sole active Subject in the work of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the lawyer story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He’s pretty gutsy... I don’t know that all lawyers would do that.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: While we were still helpless, Christ died for the ungodly.
God helps those who help themselves... he couldn’t have demolished it more succinctly.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lt. Piette is used as an illustration, but the preacher carefully subordinates him as a 'dim reflection' of the true Subject, Christ.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: Abraham is a model of trust in God's action, not his own.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the reality of 'being remade'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the human courtroom to the divine tribunal is seamless and reinforces the primary soteriological program.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'forgiveness' (perceived as weak) and 'justification' (perceived as robust).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of God... has stepped out in front to protect us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son and Father; the Spirit's role in 'remaking' is implied but not named.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is 'high-handed' and renders the human 'helpless'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered entirely by Divine agency. The human actants are correctly positioned as 'ungodly' receivers.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Gospel' balance.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon could benefit from a brief mention of the 'Vouloir' (the new will) that results from being remade.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It uses a contemporary 'hero' story only to immediately pivot to human helplessness and divine rescue.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'failing NYT' hook; Greimas shows that the hook serves to establish the 'Subject' of the defense.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 5; Greimas shows how the sermon *functions* as a delivery of the power described in Romans 5.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the preacher successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap (where God just helps us be better) by making God the 'Subject' who does what we cannot.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Son of God stepped out
volledige_object_lijst: The image of the new Adam
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the hymn at the end to move the hearer from a 'Receiver' of information to a 'Participant' in the confession of helplessness.
